questions.question: Which type of verb can be changed from active to passive voice?
questions.explanation: Only transitive verbs (verbs with objects) can be changed to passive voice because the object becomes the new subject.

questions.question: In the sentence 'The book was read by John', what is 'The book'?
questions.explanation: In passive voice, the subject receives the action rather than performing it. 'John' is the agent who performs the action.

questions.question: What is the passive voice form of 'She writes a letter'?
options: A letter is written by her
A letter was written by her
A letter has been written by her
A letter is being written by her
questions.correct_answer: A letter is written by her
questions.explanation: Simple present active (writes) becomes is/am/are + V3 (is written) in passive voice.

questions.question: What is the passive voice form of 'They built the house'?
options: The house is built by them
The house was built by them
The house has been built by them
The house will be built by them
questions.correct_answer: The house was built by them
questions.explanation: Simple past active (built) becomes was/were + V3 (was built) in passive voice.

questions.question: What is the passive voice formula for simple future tense?
questions.explanation: Simple future passive uses: will/shall + be + past participle (V3).

questions.question: Identify the voice: 'The cake is being baked by my mother.'
questions.explanation: The subject 'cake' receives the action. The structure 'is being baked' shows present continuous passive.

questions.question: What is the passive form of 'He is writing a poem'?
options: A poem is written by him
A poem was being written by him
A poem is being written by him
A poem has been written by him
questions.correct_answer: A poem is being written by him
questions.explanation: Present continuous (is writing) becomes is/am/are + being + V3 (is being written).

questions.question: What is the passive form of 'She has completed the work'?
options: The work is completed by her
The work was completed by her
The work has been completed by her
The work had been completed by her
questions.correct_answer: The work has been completed by her
questions.explanation: Present perfect (has completed) becomes has/have + been + V3 (has been completed).

questions.question: In passive voice, the doer of the action is introduced by which word?
questions.explanation: In passive voice, the agent (doer) is introduced by the preposition 'by'. Example: 'The book was written by the author.'

questions.question: Which sentence is in active voice?
questions.explanation: 'She teaches English' is active because the subject 'She' performs the action. The others have the subject receiving the action.

questions.question: What is the passive form of 'They had finished the project'?
options: The project was finished by them
The project has been finished by them
The project had been finished by them
The project will be finished by them
questions.correct_answer: The project had been finished by them
questions.explanation: Past perfect (had finished) becomes had + been + V3 (had been finished).

questions.question: Which sentence CANNOT be changed to passive voice?
questions.explanation: 'Sleeps' is an intransitive verb (no object), so it cannot be converted to passive voice.

questions.question: What is the passive form of 'The teacher will have taught the lesson'?
options: The lesson will be taught by the teacher
The lesson will have been taught by the teacher
The lesson has been taught by the teacher
The lesson is being taught by the teacher
questions.correct_answer: The lesson will have been taught by the teacher
questions.explanation: Future perfect (will have taught) becomes will + have + been + V3 (will have been taught).

questions.question: In the sentence 'The mouse was chased by the cat', who performed the action?
questions.explanation: In passive voice, the agent after 'by' is the doer. Here, 'the cat' performed the action of chasing.

questions.question: What is the active form of 'The song was sung by the choir'?
options: The choir was singing the song
The choir has sung the song
questions.explanation: 'Was sung' (simple past passive) becomes 'sang' (simple past active). Note: 'sang' is the correct past tense of 'sing'.

questions.question: Which helping verb pattern indicates present continuous passive?
questions.explanation: Present continuous passive uses: is/am/are + being + past participle.

questions.question: What is the passive form of 'Someone stole my bicycle'?
questions.explanation: Simple past (stole) becomes was/were + V3. 'By someone' is often omitted when the agent is unknown or unimportant.

questions.question: In passive voice, what happens to the object of the active sentence?
questions.explanation: In passive transformation, the object of the active sentence becomes the subject of the passive sentence.

questions.question: What is the passive form of 'Children are flying kites'?
options: Kites are being flown by children
Kites were being flown by children
Kites have been flown by children
questions.correct_answer: Kites are being flown by children
questions.explanation: Present continuous (are flying) becomes are + being + V3 (are being flown).

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct passive form of 'He can solve this problem'?
options: This problem can be solved by him
This problem is solved by him
This problem was solved by him
This problem could be solved by him
questions.correct_answer: This problem can be solved by him
questions.explanation: Modal verbs (can, may, must, etc.) in passive become: modal + be + V3.

questions.question: What is V1, V2, and V3 of the verb 'write'?
questions.explanation: V1 (base form) = write, V2 (past tense) = wrote, V3 (past participle) = written.

questions.question: Identify the tense in passive voice: 'The match had been won by our team.'
questions.explanation: The structure 'had been + V3' indicates past perfect passive tense.

questions.question: What is the passive form of 'We must obey the rules'?
options: The rules must be obeyed by us
The rules are obeyed by us
The rules should be obeyed by us
The rules have to be obeyed by us
questions.correct_answer: The rules must be obeyed by us
questions.explanation: Modal 'must' + V1 becomes must + be + V3 in passive voice.

questions.question: Which sentence is in past continuous passive?
questions.explanation: Past continuous passive uses: was/were + being + V3.

questions.question: What is the active form of 'The thief has been caught by the police'?
options: The police have caught the thief
The police had caught the thief
The police are catching the thief
questions.correct_answer: The police have caught the thief
questions.explanation: 'Has been caught' (present perfect passive) becomes 'have caught' (present perfect active). 'Police' takes plural verb.

questions.question: In which voice is this sentence: 'Birds build nests'?
questions.explanation: The subject 'Birds' performs the action of building. This is active voice.

questions.question: What is the passive form of 'She may help you'?
options: You may be helped by her
You might be helped by her
You will be helped by her
questions.correct_answer: You may be helped by her
questions.explanation: Modal 'may' is retained in passive: may + be + V3.

questions.question: Which verb form is used after 'being' in continuous passive?
questions.explanation: In continuous passive (is/was being + V3), the past participle follows 'being'.

questions.question: What is the passive form of 'People speak English everywhere'?
questions.explanation: Simple present passive. 'By people' is omitted as it's understood/general.

questions.question: Identify the voice: 'Let the door be opened.'
questions.explanation: 'Let + object + be + V3' is the imperative passive structure.
